channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Garden Plot: Plant now to have blooms throughout spring
item.description: We’ve recently had some nice soaking rains to moisten the soil, making it a great time to plant some spring bloomers.
item.dc:creator: Diane Lynch

item.title: New murals from Bay Area artists decorate Strawberry Village
item.description: Visitors to Strawberry Village will see new splashes of color throughout the center in the form of three murals by Bay Area artists.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Strawberry artist depicts portraits of luck through lottery scratchers
item.description: Strawberry artist Ben Benet found inspiration for one of his recent projects in his experiences playing lottery scratchers.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Students transform Bel Aire into chocolate factory for ‘Willy Wonka’ spring play
item.description: Bel Aire Elementary School students will transport audiences to a world of pure imagination in their production of “Willy Wonka Jr."
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Marin supervisors revise housing plans to meet court, state requirements
item.description: Officials removed controversial “precedence clauses” while adding new fair-housing language.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Tiburon names three new faces to diversity, parks and design boards
item.description: The Tiburon Town Council appointed Lina Godfrey, Mike Ghaffary and Phoebe Holscher.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Rare beach-access lot hits the market for $3.995 mil
item.description: The rare waterfront lot on Paradise Drive has beach access and approved plans for a 6,500-square-foot home.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Local teens help launch prom boutique to make attire accessible to all
item.description: Two local teens are leading an effort to ensure all high-school students can afford to look their best at prom.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Award-winning S.F. bakery Tartine to return to Mill Valley roots at Strawberry Village
item.description: Renowned Bay Area bakery Tartine will make its Marin debut at the Strawberry Village shopping center later this year.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Everyday Encounter: A former sausageman’s health issues don’t dampen his positive attitude
item.description: William Schwarz of Tiburon grew up in Belvedere, played football and rugby and headed sales for family business Schwarz Sausage Co.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.description: Visitors to Strawberry Village will see new splashes of color throughout the center in the form of three murals by Bay Area artists.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Jerome ‘Jerry’ Meislin
item.description: Jerome “Jerry” Meislin passed away peacefully in his sleep on February 12th, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Reader submitted

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A local Italian teacher brings language and culture to the peninsula
item.description: Born in Genoa and raised in Milan, Tiburon's Alessandra Beraldi launched her own business, Italian with Alessandra, in early 2020.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Hootenanny Fridays strike a chord at library
item.description: Hootenanny Fridays meets from 1 to 2:30 p.m. on first and third Fridays of the month in the Founders Room at the Belvedere-Tiburon Library.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Town Hall exhibit features art from Marin City collective
item.description: Seven members of the Marin City Arts and Culture collective are displaying their paintings in a new exhibit at Tiburon Town Hall.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Angel Island reopens 16 boat slips, pushes dock renovation to 2026
item.description: Angel Island State Park has reopened 16 of its 42 boat slips at Ayala Cove after making temporary repairs to address safety concerns.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Teachers seek 23% salary boost over next two years; Reed district counters with 5%
item.description: Teachers say a larger salary increase is necessary to keep pace with the high cost of living in Marin.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Termination of popular librarian sparks controversy amid review of workplace culture
item.description: A library consultant says workplace culture is improving and that supporters of a fired staffer have "weaponized" his initial findings.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Local officials discuss wildfire safety, new hazard maps after L.A. blazes
item.description: Public-safety officials say the Tiburon Peninsula faces relatively low wildfire risk due to its fog layer and moisture, supported by new ris
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: No barriers, just space: Tiburon eyes 1-foot gap for sidewalk dining
item.description: The Tiburon Town Council subcommittee working to formalize outdoor dining regulations is proposing a simplified safety requirement.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon OKs Main Street closure for Ranch anniversary celebration
item.description: The Ranch will celebrate its 50th anniversary with a May 16 block party on lower Main Street after snagging the second of three...
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez
